fields.description:
After installing Stash using the installer, user needs to manually rename the dll files to make the service work.
rename tomcat7.exe tomcat7.exe.x86
rename tcnative-1.dll tcnative-1.dll.x86
rename tomcat7.exe.x64 tomcat7.exe
rename tcnative-1.dll.x64 tcnative-1.dll


In system event logs, it just display only: "The Atlassian Stash service terminated with service-specific error Incorrect function."

After renaming the files the service works fine.
fields.summary: Installer does not rename dll files necessary to run Stash as a Service.

fields.description: Add customisation option to define minimum number of reviewers before a pull request is created.
fields.summary: Minimum number of reviewers to allow creation of pull request

fields.description: Add customisation option to define minimum number of reviewers before a pull request is created.
fields.summary: Minimum number of reviewers to allow creation of pull request

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to rename branches from the stash web interface.

This is useful if the wrong JIRA has been used in the branch name, or there's a typo, or something, and simpler than doing it client side (which requires a rename locally, push new branch, delete old branch, and also loses pull requests/etc)
fields.summary: Ability to rename branches from web interface

fields.description: It would be very nice to be able to search for pull requests by user. i.e., given a user, what open pull requests do they have?
fields.summary: Need ability to search for pull requests by user

fields.description:
When reviewing code using Diff (side-by-side), resizing the browser window cases the diff to jump back to the top.
To reproduce:
1. Go to Diff tab, using side-by-side diff'ing
2. Scroll down
3. Resize browser window (even by just a few pixesl)
4. Observe that diff code scrolls back to the top.
This behavior is highly annoying as one losses the position of where they were reviewing.

I am using Chrome.
fields.summary: Resizing the browser window causes diff view to jump to the top

fields.description:
Currently, the button for accessing the repository settings is in the lower left corner. (See screenshot)

This position is hardly recognized. In worse case it is even below the page footer. Also, it is quite unexpected, since it is not grouped to other menu items or buttons.

Please, place it next to the other menu items belonging to the repository.
fields.summary: Fix placement of repository settings button

fields.description:
In former versions of Stash the most important functionality of Stash (creating pull requests), was on the most prominent position in the upper right corner. This simplified my daily workflow a lot: just logging in and clicking "Create Pull Request" - and I was done.

Nowadays, I have to click through hierarchies to get it. (See screenshot)

It would be really great, if you could place this button on a more accessible position. At least outside the ellipsis - but even better - on the main menu level.

Thank you!
fields.summary: More prominent position for "Create Pull request"
Update nginx documentation

fields.description:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/stash/3.1.3/web-common/reference/com/atlassian/stash/web/conditions/IsPersonalProjectCondition.html is a documented condition that checks if a project is a personal project or not. However, this doesn't work from a plugin, because that condition's constructor (and the related IsPersonalRepositoryCondition) takes an InternalProjectService param, and that bean isn't exported.

Loading a plugin with the web-item in atlassian-plugin.xml :

<web-item key="test" name="test" section="stash.repository.nav" weight="1000">
  <label key="label" />
  <param name="stashIconClass" value="aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-add" />
  <link>/</link>
	
  <condition class="com.atlassian.stash.web.conditions.IsPersonalRepositoryCondition">
    <param name="onlyMine">false</param>
  </condition>
</web-item>

gives the error:

[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-07-24 17:51:05,737 ERROR [UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-3] admin 1071x3033x0 6mkppg 127.0.0.1 "POST /rest/plugins/1.0/ HTTP/1.1" c.a.p.manager.DefaultPluginManager There was an error loading the descriptor 'test' of plugin 'com.example.stash.projectconditionerror'. Disabling.
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'com.atlassian.stash.web.conditions.IsPersonalRepositoryCondition': Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 0 of type [com.atlassian.stash.internal.project.InternalProjectService]: : No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.stash.internal.project.InternalProjectService] is defined: Unsatisfied dependency of type [interface com.atlassian.stash.internal.project.InternalProjectService]: expected at least 1 matching bean; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.stash.internal.project.InternalProjectService] is defined: Unsatisfied dependency of type [interface com.atlassian.stash.internal.project.InternalProjectService]: expected at least 1 matching bean

A search for 'Internal' in the source code (stash-parent/web-common/src/main/java/com/atlassian/stash/web/conditions) shows a few other potentially useful conditions that may have the same issue (eg HasPullRequestWatchCondition and HasPersonalForkCondition) although I haven't tried using those.
fields.summary: IsPersonalProjectCondition/IsPersonalRepositoryCondition doesn't work from a plugin

fields.description:
In a repository with a large number of branches the fact that the lists of branches/tags is not sorted makes it very difficult unless you know the full name you are looking for.
It would be nice if you could sort the lists by the various column headers Branch and Update and also to filter branches based on whether or not they are merged.
fields.summary: Lists of branches/Tags not sorted

fields.description: I really like them. But is there somewhere where I can see a list of all the open ones?
fields.summary: Tasks are cool!
API: Add ability to enable public access on repositories

fields.description: Currently, when a user or group is deleted from Stash, we delete its associated permissions. When this is done, it is not added as an entries into the audit log. It would be good to know for recovery situations what permissions were deleted so that they can be manually restored.
fields.summary: Revocation of permissions when a user or group is cleaned up is not in the audit logs

fields.description:
I have a script to managed the configuration of the 100+ projects, and 300+ repos we hold in Stash, and their hooks.

It has become apparent, that certainly since our most recent upgrade to 3.1.1, the Stash API for enabling hooks appears broken.

We have a number of pre-receive plugins configured, including:
com.atlassian.stash.plugin.stash-protect-unmerged-branch-hook:protect-unmerged-branch-hook
com.teslamotors.stash.hook.jira-issue-enforcer:commit-message-issue-enforcer
and a couple of our own.

Configured and enabled manually by hand, these plugins all work fine, but if I send the following curl request to the API...

curl -u *USER*:*PASSWORD* -X PUT -H "Accept: application/json"  -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://stash.*DOMAIN*.com/rest/api/1.0/projects/ageas/repos/scripts/settings/hooks/com.teslamotors.stash.hook.jira-issue-enforcer%3Acommit-message-issue-enforcer/enabled"  -d '{"checkJiraExistenceEnabled":true,"jiraApplicationLinkEnabled":true,"jiraBaseUrl":"https:\/\/jira.*DOMAIN*.com","jiraUsername":"","jiraPassword":"","exemptMergeCommits":true,"allowExemptionKeyword":true,"jiraExemptionRegex":"\\[NO_ISSUE\\]","checkForIssueMoveEnabled":true,"watershedCommitLogMessageEnforcement":"","branchNamespaces":" "}'

I get the following response:

array (
  'details' => 
  array (
    'key' => 'com.teslamotors.stash.hook.jira-issue-enforcer:commit-message-issue-enforcer',
    'name' => 'Commit Log Message JIRA® Issue Reference Enforcer',
    'type' => 'PRE_RECEIVE',
    'description' => 'Enforces that all commits contain a (valid) Jira issue reference or explicit exemption (via the string "#noissue").',
    'version' => '1.1',
    'configFormKey' => 'com.teslamotors.stash.hook.jira-issue-enforcer:commit-message-issue-enforcer-config-form',
  ),
  'enabled' => true,
  'configured' => true,
)

This is the same for all plugins - both 'enabled' and 'configured' are true.

However, the plugins then do not get applied -  at all - when configured using the API (even disabling and re-enabling does nothing).

If I go into the Hooks settings for a repo, the plugin displays as ENABLED (as expected). Going into the settings and saving the configuration manually, does make this work (but isn't suitable for 300+ repos...)

Thanks.
fields.summary: Enabling hooks via REST API doesn't *actually* enable them

fields.description:
Guys,

Last week we upgraded from Stash 2.12 to 3.1.1, and since then auto updating of Pull Requests on subsequent push to same branch no longer works.

Steps:
1) Commit
2) Push
3) Create PR
4) Commit
5) Push

At this point, in Stash 2.12, the commit would appear in the PR with the [UPDATED] lozenge. In 3.1.1, this behaviour is no longer present, with the users having to decline the PR and re-open for the update to appear.

No log messages were output during these actions.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Pull requests no longer automatically updated

fields.description:
-The HipChat notification hook doesn't allow you to specify the URL of an on-premise HipChat server. That improvement is required.- Fixed in Stash 3.2 per STASH-4636

-As a further improvement,- I'd like to suggest that the URL, token and room be specified at the system level and then allow repositories to override those values if needed. The current methodology simply isn't scalable - too much scope for error.
fields.summary: Configure HipChat token and room at global/project level
As a Stash administrator I'd like to have "repository creator" as a separate permission at the project level.

fields.description:
Provide an option to use a particular branch type (For example: release) as the default selection when creating branches.

"we would like to make custom as default since we already have our own branch naming strategy and convention."
fields.summary: Default "branch type" setting for creation of branches

fields.description:
As a Stash plugin developer, I'd like Stash to have 'Update' hook support in its API besides pre-receive and post-receive.

if a user chooses to install/enable and update hook then it would be wise to make them aware of the performance impact of doing so, but to restrict this feature entirely is a bit mean of atlassian.

I have a commit message enforcer hook that currently runs as a pre-receive, which works fine mostly, but I found that if a user pushes an entirely new branch to the repo and that new branch contains a commit that does not conform to the enforcer rules, this is not caught by pre-recieve. This has the knock on affect of then being properly enforced when that new branch is merged. Which leaves the user stuck and intervention is required in order for it to continue.

Could you please reconsider the implementation of update hooks which would solve this.
fields.summary: Reassess 'Update' hook support to Stash API

fields.description:
Loving the branch comparison guys!

For one of our use cases, it would be nice to be able to specify a point in time (commit) at which to do the branch comparison.

Ie: Compare {{refs/heads/my_branch@cac0cab538b970a37ea1e769cbbde608743bc96d}} to {{refs/heads/master}}

Cheers :)
fields.summary: Extend branch compare to allow commit specification

fields.description: https://jdog.jira-dev.com/issues/?jql=issue%20in%20linkedIssues("JDEV-28572") ends up terminating the link after the first open brace, which breaks the link.
fields.summary: Link is not rendered correctly in comment

fields.description:
According to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Configuring+syntax+highlighting+for+file+extensions the highlighting for CMake is applied to files with the "makefile" extension.  But this is inappropriate.

CMake is used in files with the name "CMakeLists.txt" (case sensitive) and additionally in files with the extensions ".cmake"

Following the instructions to override the file extensions I've added
syntax.highlighter.cmake.extensions=CMakeLists.txt,cmake
to the stash-config.properties file and it appears to work for .cmake files but not for the CMakeLists.txt files.  I presume this is because it is trying to match *.CMakeLists.txt which of course fails.  Understandably applying CMake syntax to all *.txt files is not desirable.  Renaming CMakeLists.txt to *.cmake is also not an option because CMake itself mandates the use of CMakeLists.txt

The default extension for CMake highlighting should be changed to .cmake and additionally there should be some way to apply highlighting based on the full filename and not just the extension.
fields.summary: Highlighting CMake files

fields.description:
Our team heavily uses Stash Pull Request functionality to perform code reviews. Overall it has been extremely helpful in ensuring that our code is seen by as many eyes as possible.

However, one problem with the current implementation is the that request is emailed for each and every comment made during a review. For longer/larger reviews this is problematic and keeping tabs on all the comments in our inbox is cumbersome. It would be extremely beneficial if there was an optional review "sessions" that could be started, paused, and completed for the reviewers. Once marked as completed the PR author would then be notified that the review was completed and that they could start reviewing the comments. This would reduce the number of notifications that are sent to the original author as well.
fields.summary: Start and stop a review sessions so that the requester can be notified when I complete my review

fields.description:
Nowadays the REST API has just some features related to tags.
It would be great if it includes:
# create tags remotely, both lightweight and annotated tags, using the REST API without having to clone the repo (the equivalent of the branch utils component but with tags).
# include the annotated tag messages in api results.

Similarly, the UI shows tags, but has no visual indicators of whether they're annotated or lightweight, and doesn't offer messages.

Lastly, the Java API ([{{Tag}}|https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/javadoc/5.8.0/api/reference/com/atlassian/bitbucket/repository/Tag.html]) also provides no access to tag messages or types (although lightweight and annotated tags _can_ be distinguished because an annotated tag will have a {{getHash()}} value where a lightweight tag will not).
fields.summary: Annotated tag support (Java and REST APIs, UI)
Audit log not showing IPs for authentication failures via SSH

fields.description:
Right now, I am using Post-Receive and Pre-Receive hooks on a few of my repositories. If someone were to do a pull request on one of those repositories and I used the built-in merge feature, not a single hook gets executed.

Can we see pr/merge hooks?
fields.summary: Stash Pull Request / Merge Hooks

fields.description:

!2.png!

As an administrator, I'd like to be able to determine what repositories a user currently has access to with what permissions. I'd also like for this to be displayed within the User's profile upon request or by default to all Administrators.

fields.description:
Hi,

From the available events I'd like to chose which events an reviewer is notified.
For example, I add a reviewer to a pull request and only want the reviewer to be notified when the pull request is approved and merged and not be notified on the other events.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Ability to chose the notification events for its reviewers

fields.description:
We have some repositories set up to require approvals from >= 1 reviewer so that the developer who opens a Pull Request cannot merge without a peer review.  As expected, the {{Merge}} button is disabled while the approval requirement has not been met; however, when a developer hovers over the disabled button the tooltip says:

bq. This pull request can't be merged automatically.

This leads some of our users to believe that the state of the source branch is not compatible with the target branch and that they need to take some action like rebasing or committing their own merge to the PR branch.  It is not necessarily obvious that the reason has nothing to do with the code or the state of the repository; this confusion may be greater in users coming from a different tool (i.e. GitHub) that does not offer approval requirements.  Even if they understand that there is such a requirement, the phrasing of the tooltip makes them think that _even if_ the pull request were approved that it still would not be in a state that allowed an automatic merge.

The caution icon to the left of the button correctly explains exactly which requirements are unmet, but it is not immediately obvious to some users that they can hover over (or click!) that icon.  Please change the tooltip on the {{Merge}} button to be more specific based on the actual conditions _or_ have it instruct the user to click the caution triangle icon for details.
fields.summary: Disabled merge button tooltip text is sometimes misleading (usability)

fields.description:
Dear Team,

I created a custom branch via Stash.
The Origin/head is also gets changed to the newly created branch and now no more master has the origin/head. 
Now i'm seriously facing issue like, while getting the master for development, i get re-directed to the newly created branch, since the origin/head points to new branch.


Can you please help me, how to change the origin/head to master branch?

Its quietly required more urgent.
fields.summary: Issue while creating a custom branch

fields.description: Allow project access key permission to override branch permission settings.
fields.summary: Allow access key permission to override branch permission

fields.description: It has a nice text that I can copy for git fetch && git checkout.
fields.summary: After branch creation, let me copy a git command to fetch and checkout

fields.description:
As a engineering manager, I need the ability to define a release in Stash and have that release definition be the single source of truth across Jira, Stash and Bamboo. Today, Jira has the concept of version, but the version capability in Jira cannot be associated with Stash (git). I want the Jira issues in the release to be reflected in Jira in a release field which comes from Stash/git. The release should be defined by using a git annotated tag and those tags available in all the tools (Jira, Stash, Bamboo). 

* https://github.com/blog/1547-release-your-software
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/312561/tag-and-lock-a-branch-for-a-release?page=1#comment-316452

Thanks,
Tom O'Hare
tohare@akamai.com
Senior Engineering Manager
Akamai Technologies
fields.summary: Adding release concept and capability to Stash and Jira

fields.description:
When running through a first-time install or a migration to a MySQL database to use with Stash, if your database name includes a "-" (dash) the migration will fail part way through. See attached for error log. Some tables are created, and then will fail part way through.

i.e. "stash-external" will fail, while "stash external" will succeed.

If nothing else, documentation, or kbase should hold this information.
fields.summary: Installation wizard and MySQL migration will fail with a "-" in the database name

fields.description:
The new sidebar in Stash 3.0 is collapsable. However, by doing so, the 4 available "Actions" get stuffed into a sub-menu with an ellipsis icon (see attached image).

I'd like to see all 4 of those Actions (Clone, Create branch, Create pull request, and Fork) placed directly on the collapsed sidebar. There is plenty of vertical space for them, I see no reason to have them inside of a submenu. It creates a major usability issue.
fields.summary: Put all buttons on collapsed sidebar (no hiding)

fields.description:
Tested in a 64 bit environment with java not installed.

Installing Stash using the installer as a service does not work.
The following error is observed
{noformat}
[2014-07-16 21:18:05] [info]  [ 7772] Commons Daemon procrun (1.0.15.0 64-bit) started
[2014-07-16 21:18:06] [info]  [ 7772] Running 'AtlassianStash' Service...
[2014-07-16 21:18:06] [info]  [ 8516] Starting service...
[2014-07-16 21:18:06] [error] [ 8516] Failed creating java 
[2014-07-16 21:18:06] [error] [ 8516] ServiceStart returned 1
[2014-07-16 21:18:06] [info]  [ 7772] Run service finished.
[2014-07-16 21:18:06] [info]  [ 7772] Commons Daemon procrun finished{noformat}

When installed using command line {{service install}}, the following is observed
{noformat}C:\Atlassian\Stash\3.1.3\bin>service install
Neither the JAVA_HOME nor the JRE_HOME environment variable is defined
Service will try to guess them from the registry.
Installing the service 'AtlassianStash' ...

fields.description: Would be nice to be able to say "1/3 reviewers approved" or similar in the message in the command line.
fields.summary: "These pull requests are ready to merge" with no approvals from the 3 reviewers

fields.description:
Currently In our company we have a project like your "Atlassian Markeptplace" Project. It has a Production branch ("master") and a Development Branch ("develop").
This Workflow is a "simplier" git-flow Workflow and just uses master, develop, hotfixes and feature branches.
If we create a feature branch it will simply merge from develop and will only be merged right into develop.
But, if some things are broken we usually create a hotfix branch from master and wanted the hotfix branch automatically back to develop.

Currently Stash only supports the automatic merge from release/ to other branches.

In a talk from some of your guys you talk about the specific workflow here:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WX0hLfaKsWg&feature=youtu.be&t=55m17s

Also I raised a QA at answers.atlassian.com:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/315802/automatic-branch-merging-master-hotfix-to-develop
fields.summary: Automatically merge hotfixes targeting my production branch to my develop branch as well

fields.description: !https://monosnap.com/image/TAsLOKDluKOSAtOrnB95FKmdhHtBf0.png!

fields.description:
If there's a link to an issue, I expect clicking it, particularly to open in a new tab, to go to the issue.

In stash, issue links go to an oauth dialog and then a dialog telling me less info than JIRA would give me (I assume).  I really just want to go to JIRA.
fields.summary: Issue links don't link to issues

fields.description:
Create a single place where permissions can be defined for similarly named branches across repositories or projects.

Use case:
- Instance with 5 projects and 25 repositories each. 
- Only a group of people can push to {{master}}.

h4. Workaround
Script permissions via the REST API:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/stash/2.2.0/stash-branch-permissions-rest.html
fields.summary: Define branch permissions across projects

fields.description: we are unable to integrate LDAP with Stash
fields.summary: Unable to integerate with Activce Directory
GitCommandFactory.type() for raw Git objects (not just content nodes)

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Add the attached [^SF132-test.zip] repository to Stash
# Navigate to the Commits menu
# Select the {{7134d1b}} commit
# Any file with "SF" followed by numbers will not be displayed correct when clicked on
## The file name will be truncated after the S
## The file will show as empty
fields.summary: Filenames containing "SF" are not displayed correctly in commits details

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. If you're really passionate about this suggestion, please comment with your case in detail and we'll reconsider. Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}

When you create an empty repository, Stash displays a helpful page with instructions on how to use git to get started.  Our developers have asked for the ability to see this page even when they do not have an empty repository for reference purposes.  Thinking further, it could be very helpful to have a link, perhaps in the top right of the page, that had a version of the "git commands tutorial" in your Stash confluence page (but actually as part of stash, since our installation is isolated from the network).
fields.summary: Add git tutorial pages to stash

fields.description:
(Taken from https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/315371/blocking-tag-moves-in-stash) :

The "reject force push" plugin doesn't seem to work for tags, only branches. Starting with an empty repository, with the "reject force push" plugin enabled:

{quote}
echo "A" > file
git add file; git commit -m 'add' file; git push
git tag -a -m 'tag' test; git push --tags
echo "B" > file
git add file; git commit -m 'change' file; git push
git tag -a -f -m 'tag2' test
git push --tags --force # This should error, but doesn't
git tag -a -f -m 'tag-back' test HEAD^ # Move the tag back to the original position
git push --tags --force # This does error
{quote}

This also happens with the marketplace 'force field' plugin, so I don't know if this is a bug with the included plugin, or something else?
fields.summary: "Reject force push" plugin doesn't block tag moves

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of November 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for voting on this suggestion. In Bitbucket Data Center 7.18 we've added HTTP Access Tokens for projects and repositories. More details can be found in the [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-data-center-and-server-7-18-release-notes-1087534957.html#BitbucketDataCenterandServer7.18releasenotes-HTTPaccesstokensforprojectsandrepositories] and official [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/http-access-tokens-939515499.html].

Anton Genkin
Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Original suggestion

As of now, build systems like TeamCity need to retrieve the sources via SSH and a private key infrastructure in order to be secure & do not use up an additional "service user" license for each project.

This has two major drawbacks:
 * It forces us to manage the private key infrastructure (administrative overhead)
 * It is not recommended to use SSH via automatic build tools according to the docs: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Enabling+SSH+access+to+Git+repositories+in+Stash]

Furthermore, it forces us to enable SSH on Stash in the first place, this is not a huge drawback (due to the minimal configuration), however, still a security issue.

Optimally we would have:
 * a default service user for each project
 * enabling the "service users" feature costs only a single user license in total (regardless of how many projects provide service users)
 * the service user can simply connect via HTTPS like all other Stash users

(see also [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/313156/stash-licensing-for-ci-build-systems] for a discussion on the topic)
fields.summary: Access keys for HTTP/HTTPS

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
An automated way of accessing the repository size on disk information would be beneficial to monitor the growth of a repository, and plan maintenance operations accordingly.

The Bitbucket Server user interface already provides access to the "Approximate size" of a repository in the repository settings page:
{noformat}
$BITBUCKET_URL/projects/<project_name>/repos/<repository_name>/settings
{noformat}
!BSERV4988_repositorySize.png|width=600px!

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a REST API endpoint to retrieve the repository disk size.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want a REST API endpoint to retrieve the disk size of a repository

fields.description:
Customising mime types in Stash today is only possible by editing the web.xml file and restarting Stash.
If would make users life easier if the mime types could me edited in admin UI.
Also, a great addition would be store the configured mime types on database, so they would be kept after upgrading the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to customise mime types

fields.description:
If I merge from my target branch into a feature branch that is in a pull request (e.g. from master into feature/ISSUE-1), using "git merge --log", it includes the commit messages from all the new work on master in the merge commit.
Stash then shows all the issues from those commits being associated with the PR in the Stash UI.
In this case this is wrong - I have simply made my feature branch as up-to-date as possible and the PR has nothing to do with those issues.
fields.summary: Don't associate a PR with a JIRA issue based on merge commit messages

fields.description:
When using Firefox, clicking the "Raw file" or "Download this file" links (and possibly other similar links) for files with spaces in the filename results in the downloaded filename being truncated up to the first space.

The bug was seen using Firefox 30, and does not occur in Internet Explorer 11. I do not have Chrome available to test.

This may be related to the following verified, "won't fix" bug in Firefox dealing with the Content-Disposition HTTP header:
[https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=221028]
fields.summary: Download file links truncate filenames containing spaces in Firefox

fields.description:
When viewing a 'Diff' of a source file, either through the branch comparison tool or in pull requests, files with a .F90 extension (not sure if it applies to .F) are not displayed as having changes in them.  See the attached screenshot.  The file is listed correctly in the 'Changed files' list but the Diff pane shows the icon with 'The contents for this file have not changed'.  If you go to a source view of the file directly from its branch and and use the 'Diff to previous' button with the history that works fine ... so the changes expected are definitely in the repository.

The root of the problem seems to be, and this can be seen from the screenshot, is that although in the 'Changed files' list the filename is correct, in the header bar for the 'Diff' pane its extension has gone missing!  If you click on the 'raw file' icon this confirms that it is trying to look for the file minus its extension.  This only seems to affect .F90 files and not .f90 ... so the capital F seems to be important but can't think why. This makes reviewing changes to .F90 files very tricky.

This wasn't an issue in 2.12.0 the last version we had before upgrading to 3.1.0.  I have tried this in IE and Firefox and it is present for both browsers.
fields.summary: STASH Diff tool does not show changes for .F90 files

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a repository
# Make some commits
# Go to commits list in Stash
# Click in the last commit
# Click back button.

After clicking in back button only some commits will be displayed instead of keep displaying all commits.
If clicking in the repository name again and then going to commits, will display the complete list again.
fields.summary: Commits disappear from commits list if clicking in back button after checking a commit.

fields.description:
Checkstyle checker feature for Stash

Original Post:
{quote}We want to setup code checkstyle checker in repository setup in stash.
For example: in svn we have setup svn checkstyle which checks coding part like space coma tabs like that. The same we want to setup in Stash.{quote}
fields.summary: Checkstyle checker in Stash

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Set up an Delegate LDAP directory in stash, with copy user on login, synchronise group memberships and group object filter of "(cn=Stash)"
# Make sure that there isn't any "Default Group Memberships"
# Create a user in LDAP as a member of LDAP groups 'Stash' and 'Stash sysadmin'
# Confirm that you can log in as that user, and that the group membership for 'Stash' (but not 'Stash sysadmin') is synced into stash.
# As the admin user, change the group object filter to be "(|(cn=Stash)(cn=Stash sysadmin))". Verify that the GUI edit page and "Directory Configuration summary" reflect the change
# Log out the LDAP user, and log back in again
# The user is not added to the 'Stash sysadmin' group
# Restart Stash
# Log in as the LDAP user
# The user is in the 'Stash sysdamin' group
# Change the group object filter to be "(|(cn=Stash)(cn=Stash sysadmin)" (NOTE the missing ")" at the end)
# No error is reported by Stash
# Restart Stash
# Try to log in as the LDAP user
# The user logs in, but the groups aren't synced, and the stash log reports:
{noformat}
2014-07-09 14:02:32,929 ERROR [http-bio-7990-exec-16] 842x223x0 2fjgvu 211.29.157.13,127.0.0.1 "POST /j_stash_security_check HTTP/1.1" c.a.c.d.DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory Could not
 update remote group imported memberships of user "bradley.baetz" in directory "Delegated Authentication Directory".
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: org.springframework.ldap.InvalidSearchFilterException: Unbalanced parenthesis; nested exception is javax.naming.directory.Invalid
SearchFilterException: Unbalanced parenthesis; remaining name 'ou=Groups,ou=staff,ou=OIE'
{noformat}
# Change the ldap filter back, and then restart stash to pick up the change
fields.summary: Delegated LDAP Group Object Filter changes require restart to take effect, and are not validated

fields.description:
!screenshot-1.png!

See first column.
fields.summary: Cropping in the branch permission page doesn't always seem necessary and hides useful information

fields.description: After merging a PR, some user are presented with error messages which say the PR cannot be merged. Internally the PR was merged ok.
fields.summary: Pull Request Overview cache headers need to force page refresh

fields.description: If I'm looking at a commit, and that commit might be because of a merge, it would be nice if I could see who made the changes on each line.  For this purpose I need to go to View Full Source, and then blame.  I'd like to be able to do it while I'll looking at the diff which shows me which files have changed and which lines within those files.
fields.summary: Can't get a blame listing while reviewing a commit.

fields.description:
We only have a partial link to JIRA, so we can't create branches from JIRA stories. Right now I'm creating branches from Stash.

It would be really great that if I start to type in a JIRA prefix into the new branch name field could fill in the story name for me as the branch name, like the JIRA side integration offers.
fields.summary: Autocomplete branch names when linked to JIRA

fields.description:
Hi,

currently when as a user you have a fork of a given central repository, there is no way to know if the user already has a fork and to navigate from the central repository to the user's fork.

In this case, I usually end up trying to fork the central repository, only to get an error message that a repository with the same name (my existing fork) already exists in my personal project. And still I have no easy way to navigate to this repository. I have to come back to the repository, go to my profile, than find the repository based on the name. This is not straightforward.

I would like the fork button to be smarter, and offer me to browse my existing fork if I have one in my personal project. I like the way github does it : it displays the list of organizations (i.e. projects) where I can create repositories, and if the corresponding org. already contains a fork of the repository, then it offers to browse it instead of creating a new one.

It would be great if it could be implemented that way in Stash.
fields.summary: Ease navigation between a central repository and my forked repository

fields.description:
In our installation the Blend and Split buttons are disabled despite the images being the same size (the image title is still the normal one: "Compare the..." rather than "...diff mode not available due...").

If I alter the dom to remove {{disabled="disabled"}} then everything works normally
fields.summary: Image Diffs do not offer Blend or Split

fields.description: I don't need to see keyboard shortcuts for the branch list while I'm on a PR.
fields.summary: Filter keyboard shortcuts dialog based on current page context

fields.description:
We should consider lowering our bounds for when we display e-diff markings so larger blocks don't include it.

Worth noting - this might confuse people who now think the whole block is changed. TBD if that is a real problem.
fields.summary: E-diff for large changed sections is distracting

fields.description:
I'm forever changing Diff view from Unified to Side-by-Side. It appears to be persisted sometimes but not between sessions.

GIF:
!stash-unified.gif!
fields.summary: Side-By-Side / Unified Preference not consistently persisted

fields.description:
With even a small number of users+repositories the small drop down menu is annoying to navigate.


It seems that the presentation order is

"master"
Then an alphabetical order of each users repositories.


Since I'm the project owner and my name comes late in the alphabet I have to constantly scroll to the end of the list.


I would propose a more useful arrangement.

"Master"
Any repositories that I have "favorited'
My repositories
Alphabetically ordered list of everyone else's repositories.
fields.summary: Change order of repositories show in pull request drop down menu

fields.description: It would be nice to have a way to hook into when pull requests are created / updated via an sdk hook or by other means.  Our business case for this is that we want to integrate a build solution into PR's so that we can have them build when PR's are created / updated.  From our current reading the only way to do this is to tap into the PR update hook which is triggered when someone visits a PR and the merge is kicked off in the background.  Looking online yields no good clean solutions and this is something that github already does very well.
fields.summary: More Hooks for Pull Request Integrations

fields.description:
Nowadays Stash uses 1024bit RSA keys.
In cases where the server uses strickhostkey, the user will need to use both keys for Stash and his regular SSH.
As a workaround for this user can edit a file called "ssh-server-keys.pem" in $STASH_HOME/config and add his key there.
But it does not support 2048 bit keys.
Extend this support to larger keys would be a great solution for this.
fields.summary: 2048 bits RSA key for Stash

fields.description:
We follow the GitFlow model and we've ended up with a lot of obsolete feature branches on our server due to people not selecting to delete feature branches after pull requests for a number of reasons (usually reticence).

We can manually clean up these branches by setting the default branch as develop and finding and deleting any which aren't ahead of the develop branch, but this is currently tricky when there are a lot of active feature branches present.

The easy solution would be to add a filter to the Branches view that allows showing only those branches that are not ahead of the default branch. Then there could also be a 'Delete All' button activated if this was enabled to delete all the branches en masse.
fields.summary: Add functionality to assist cleaning up obsolete branches

fields.description:
When attempting to add an SSH key while SSH access keys are disabled on the Stash server, Stash throws a 500 Internal server error.

This should probably be a 400 or 405.

See sample request/response below.

{noformat}
> POST /rest/keys/1.0/projects/FE/repos/jquery/ssh?xoauth_requestor_id=lpater HTTP/1.1
> User-Agent: curl/7.22.0 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.22.0 OpenSSL/1.0.1 zlib/1.2.3.4 libidn/1.23 librtmp/2.3
> Host: stash-app.internal.atlassian.com
> Accept: */*
> Authorization: Basic BASIC:BASIC
> Content-Type: application/json
> Content-Length: 881
> 
* upload completely sent off: 881out of 881 bytes
< HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
< Date: Tue, 08 Jul 2014 09:14:57 GMT
< Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
< X-AREQUESTID: 554x512524x12
< X-AUSERNAME: lpater
< X-AUSERID: 1211
< X-ASESSIONID: 3rkavi
< Cache-Control: no-cache, no-transform
< Vary: X-AUSERNAME,Accept-Encoding
< Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
< X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
< Connection: close
< Transfer-Encoding: chunked
< 
* Closing connection #0
{"errors":[{"context":null,"message":"Support for SSH access keys has been disabled. Please contact an administrator","exceptionName":"com.atlassian.stash.ssh.api.SshKeyAccessDisabledException"}]}
{noformat}
fields.summary: Stash returns a 500 error through the API if you try to add an SSH access key to a repo while ssh access keys are disabled

fields.description:
As a follow up to STASH-4963 we should consider turning off Git auto gc for large (for some tbd definition of large) repositories.

Auto GC may be triggered at any time and can take a considerable amount of time for large repositories during which users don't get a hint as to what is going on.

STASH-4963 demonstrates one example where GC is happening during a push.

For forks we already turn off auto gc and do the garbage collection in the background. While this shouldn't be the default for *all* repositories (auto gc has the advantage of happening when necessary without any scheduling concern from our end) it could be beneficial for teams with large repositories as it would avoid opaque pauses.
fields.summary: Disable auto.gc for large repositories

fields.description:
h3. Overview
MySQL uses Global Transaction Identifiers as part of their replication mechanism. See http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/replication-gtids.html

h3. Issue
Customers hitting this issue will see a message on the application logs similar to the one below:
{noformat}
2015-07-07 17:06:16,123 WARN  [http-bio-7990-exec-15] <user> @1Q5I8BYx1026x359x1 1wn1yo6 <IP>,<IP> "DELETE /projects/<SLUG>/repos/<SLUG> HTTP/1.1" o.h.h.s.TemporaryTableBulkIdStrategy unable to drop temporary id table after use [When @@GLOBAL.ENFORCE_GTID_CONSISTENCY = 1, the statements CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE and DROP TEMPORARY TABLE can be executed in a non-transactional context only, and require that AUTOCOMMIT = 1.]
{noformat}

That happens because of {{ENFORCE_GTID_CONSISTENCY = 1}} on the MySQL database. 

h3. Workaround

Turn off {{ENFORCE_GTID_CONSISTENCY}} on the database.


*Note:* This precludes the use of Google Cloud SQL, which enforces the use of GTID
fields.summary: Support MySQL Replication using Global Transaction IDs

fields.description:
e Just waited 2 minutes for tiny change on master (no new branch involved):

{quote}
piotrs@MacBook-Pro-Swiety fe-git (master) $ time git push
Counting objects: 15, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (7/7), done.
Writing objects: 100% (8/8), 928 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 8 (delta 5), reused 0 (delta 0)
To ssh://git@stash.atlassian.com:7997/fecru/fecru.git
  c3684d6..6b74a8a  master -> master

real    2m0.462s
user    0m0.097s
sys    0m0.102s"
{quote}

Happened at 5:07am AEST (2014-07-08)

cc [~npellow]
fields.summary: Slow pushes on stash.atlassian.com

fields.description:
If I open a PR and am looking at it, I'd like some indication that a change was made to the PR I'm looking it rather than having to refresh the page or check email.

For example, either a notification could pop-up in the right corner of the browser that something changed and the page needs refresh, or the page could just automatically update to show changes that are happening in near real-time.

It is annoying to IM someone asking them to review the PR because they were busy and find out that some time before they had approved the PR and I was looking at stale data in the PR page I had open in front of me.
fields.summary: Update/provide visual notification in real time when PR updated
Creating branch in JIRA leads to invalid ref name in STASH.

fields.description:
When displaying Commit authors in the commit list, Stash searches the name by using the git email that was used to commit.

When there are multiple user directories, Stash user management checks for the same usernames and uses the information from the directory with higher priority.

Two account may have the same username but different email and display name. If the commit author email matches one of the account in the lower priority directory (which is not displayed in the list of users), it will display the name from the lower priority directory.

Steps to replicate:
# Create an account in Stash with the following details (where the internal directory has a lower precedence)
** User Name = testaccount
** Name = Stash User
** Email = stashtest@test.com
# Create an account in Jira with the following details  (where the JIRA directory has a higher precedence)
** User Name = testaccount
** Name = Jira User
** Email = jiratest@test.com
# Link Jira User directory in Stash. Set it as higher priority than Stash Internal Directory.
# Perform a commit with email address stashtest@test.com
# The author name is shown as "Stash User" in Stash. Clicking on the user name would link it to the account page of "Jira User".
# "Stash User" is not listed in the list of user because "Jira User" is shown as the name for username "testaccount"

h2. Workaround

Configure a [mailmap|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Git+resources#Gitresources-Git.mailmap] for the email address
fields.summary: Support email address aggregation for shadowed users

fields.description: When the current host key cannot be read a new key will be generated. To avoid accidentally overwriting the key, the original key file should be retained (e.g. with a timestamped file name) instead of being overwritten.
fields.summary: Don't overwrite the SSH host key when a new key is generated

fields.description:
Hi, can you make the blame output more useful?
Right now it shows only date, and no good visual clue on what lines or sections of lines are concerned.
Used to blame since over 10 years, stash's blame is clearly sub-par. Even emacs can do better.
Please add time, use colors and and other visual clues, in short, approach the better tools. 
As this is a major feature to me, I regret to say that until this is improved, I see no value in Stash.
fields.summary: Improve blame user experience

fields.description:
Please update also the download link to the new software version

http://gitcredentialstore.codeplex.com/releases/view/106064

Thanks
fields.summary: Update git-credential-winstore download link

fields.description: A plugin developer can currently create a general or focused layout using decorators, but not hybrid layouts.
fields.summary: Add a decorator for ADG hybrid layouts

fields.description:
When the state doesn't include the object required, the API currently returns an empty object, instead of null.

To avoid breaking backwards compatibility where people have done workarounds like {{if (state.getPullRequest().id) ...}}, we can't accurately fix this until Stash 4.0.

In the meantime, we'll return false in place of undefined and null, which will prevent the above workaround from throwing an error. In Stash 4.0 this crutch will be removed and null or undefined will be returned as appropriate.
fields.summary: JS State API returns empty object in place of undefined.

fields.description: Tabbing from the comment box should go to submit first. Preview and help are infrequently used actions IMO, so we should tabindex=-1 them.
fields.summary: Tab ordering in comments
Spacing after tip

fields.description:
When using the git blame feature it is not enough for me to see user and time. In most cases I also want to know why a line was changed. At the moment I have to use the link on the commit id. I suggest to show the commit message in a tooltip, that is loaded after a short time.

Thanks,
Simon
fields.summary: git blame: Show commit message

fields.description:
Having a Stash and Jira instance running both behind a proxy with HTTPS creating the application link from Stash to Jira does not work.

There is a JS exception shown mentioning that the request was blocked by the Mixed Content Blocker of FF. Indeed, the request for the following link does not have the https protocol:

http://HOSTNAME/rest/applinks/2.0/applicationlink/86687bdb-1374-3515-b07b-44479edb06d5?_=1404428860983

Also, some of the resources of the application link dialog are not loaded with the https protocol:

- http://HOSTNAME/s/en/9b1d5d3/1/4.2.1/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-images/images/types/16stash.png
- http://HOSTNAME/s/en_US/9b1d5d3/1/4.2.1/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-images/images/types/16jira.png

Seems like the application link module internally fails to use the right protocol despite showing the Application URL and Display URL correctly with the https protocol.
fields.summary: Application link with JIRA not working in FF due to Mixed Content Blocker.

fields.description:
Some ideas for HipChat notifications:

Identify a specific branch or branches for Pull Requests, Pushes, Merges.  If I were using GitFlow, I'd only really care about Master, Develop, and Release branches.
fields.summary: Specify specific branches for HipChat notifications

fields.description:
Someone clicking the "Approve" button on the pull request overview page has no way to know what is being approved as the page does not self-update when there is activity (by others).

This is particularly problematic when the pull request is rescoped (e.g. a new commit has been pushed).

In contrast, clicking "Merge" fails with the following message: "You are attempting to modify a pull request based on out-of-date information."

Similarly, there is the unsupported "auto unapprove" plugin which  addresses a similar issue, but it makes no sense to me why:
# "auto unapprove" is a plugin, and an unsupported one at that
# "auto unapprove" is not the default behavior.

These problems make it difficult to use Stash pull requests as part of a strong set of security controls over code changes/promotions.
fields.summary: pull request approvals are inherently insecure

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian Support,

Now that we have branch comparison in stash without the need for a pull request, it would be nice that, when a diff shows a commit change in a submodule that is hosted on the same stash server (or bitbucket…), we get a direct link to see the diff between these 2 versions.

Best regards.
Sébastien
fields.summary: Direct link to see change difference from a submodule

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. If you're really passionate about this suggestion, please comment with your case in detail and we'll reconsider. Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}

Dear Stash support team,

we have a request from our users to provide sharing buttons like in Confluence for Stash. They want to share repositories, code snippets and pull requests with their colleagues. Is there a possibility to do this? If not, could you please create an internal wish list entry from this?

Thanks!

Jürgen
fields.summary: Users request a "share" functionality in Stash

fields.description: When clicking the JIRA development panel to create a Stash branch, if the JIRA summary contains non-ASCII characters (Japanese, Korean, umlaut, etc.), the Stash URL will contain the summary correctly, but the non-ASCII characters are not visible in the Branch Name field.
fields.summary: Stash create branch page unable to use Japanese, Korean and other non-ASCII characters from JIRA link in the branch name

fields.description: Comes in grey then fills in. Distracting.
fields.summary: Flash of unstyled content for line numbers on loading a file in firefox

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page with several improvements you’ve been asking us, including support of the native Ctrl+F search dialog. The page will not hijack browser search dialog anymore, which will add comfort to your code review experience. 

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
 Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}

*Original message*

It wouldn't be horrible except that in my browser, ctrl+f allows me to press enter to cycle between the N matches that are on the page. Pressing enter in stash's ctrl+f closes the find window and doesn't scroll to the next match.

Is outputting the full file at a given commit hash then overlaying the diff a significant performance issue? Can we make it work for files up to a certain reasonable size, and only incur the poor UX if your file is over a certain length?
fields.summary: Ctrl+F override is painful
